results.title: Rev
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description: This painterly observation of pedestrian traffic through a revolving door finds a counterpoint in the flickering of a candle flame. As separate lives are blurred with the energy of constant movement, individuals merge into an abstracted urban sound and light space.
results.description: This painterly observation of pedestrian traffic through a revolving door finds a counterpoint in the flickering of a candle flame. As separate lives are blurred with the energy of constant movement, individuals merge into an abstracted urban sound and light space.

results.title: Finally destroy us
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description: Kalin’s short video works function both as visual poems and as alternative music videos. With their astute conjunctions of image, music and text, these tapes respond to issues of sexuality and human interaction in the 1990s, more than a decade into the AIDS crisis. In finally destroy us, Kalin uses found film footage, home movies, and haunting pop music (Annie Lenox singing Cole Porter) to poignantly recall moments of love, shared and lost. The title is taken from Virginia Woolf: ‘But these meetings, these partings, finally destroy us’.

results.title: Inside outside...inside out
results.brief_description: Kristie remembers her childhood and teenage years as unhappy ones, of abuse and internal struggle. But at age 19, her life began to turn around through three very special people - Linda, Liz and Penny.

results.title: 3 years = Three years
results.brief_description: For Calvin, joining up with Green Corps when he was 20 proved to be a turning point in his life. Motivated and inspired by the people he met in Green Corps, three years on, he is now successfully employed, confident and making the most of every opportunity that comes his way.

results.title: Beacon of light
results.brief_description: Melanie despised the fact that she came from an artistic family but eventually through their support and determination she would learn to love the world of art and indeed become part of this world she once so strongly rejected.

results.title: Another tide: a Green Corps story
results.brief_description: Melanie has put to music her thoughts and feelings about her time spent at the beautiful location of Coningham Bay in Tasmania with the Coningham Green Corps team.

results.title: A Tail of Harry
results.brief_description: This is for Harry, much-loved cat. Harry is getting on and he just about suffers from every complaint possible for a cat including FIV (cat version of AIDS). But that doesn’t stop Harry - he just keeps soldiering on, supplied of course with lots of TLC.

results.title: Home
results.brief_description: As a child home was just an illusion. Growing up, moving overseas, home became temperal and Australia became “just back home” and on returning home, nothing made sense - everything had changed. Perhaps my mother’s words that “home is where the heart is” says it all.

results.title: Bellbird: Episode 205
results.creator_credit: Keith Wilkes, Oscar Whitbread and ABC
results.brief_description:
The ABC produced 1693 episodes of ‘Bellbird’ and the series ran for 10 years, until 1977. The series was a huge hit in rural and regional Australia because it dealt with the concerns of people living on the land and the dynamics of small country town life.
Episode 205 was broadcast on 1 January 1967.
